title: Some dev services are restarted on dev mode restart
body:
### Describe the bug

I am not sure if this is a bug, or if its as intended, but when using the dev mode, or test mode some database services are always restarted on changes, but it depends on the dev service.

For example with a test container config with `testcontainers.reuse.enable=false`
when using _mariadb_  or _mysql_ the dev container is always restarted on changes, but when using _kafka_ or _mongodb_ the services are not restarted.

With `testcontainers.reuse.enable=true` they are never stopped, but then we have to clean them up manually which makes it unpractical to use.

Happens with gradle and maven



### Expected behavior

I think it should be the same behaviour independent of the devservices.
This only happen since arround quarkus 3.7.0 , and i couldn't find any documentation on this behaviour change.
It used to never restart the devservices on reload, independent of the  `testcontainers.reuse.enable`


### Actual behavior

Some devservices are always restarted on reload, if the `testcontainers.reuse.enable` is set to `false`

### How to Reproduce?

Ensure that you disabled testcontainer re use in `~/.testcontainers.properties`
```
testcontainers.reuse.enable=false
```

Then create a sample quarkus app with
```shell
quarkus create app -x 'quarkus-rest, mongodb-panache, jdbc-mysql,hibernate-orm-panache' quarkus-virt -P 3.9.3
```

Then go in the directory and run `quarkus dev`

When restarting the application, by pressing `s` or making changes, you will see that only the _mysql_  devservice is restarted
